posts.body:
Yeah, I'm not going to make a script to create ZeroID certs. At least not right now.
It's doable, though, but probably time consuming. You could generate lots of certs and then use them all to spam.
Hope you had fun, sorry for the trouble.


Nah, it's your work, you do it for free :^)

btw, this is a print of my Windows tray after stopping the bots.
The ZeroNet icons filled my entire screen and Windows complained about too many icons lmao

>>07675ae0-4941-4c6d-b052-bd826434230e
Yep, break and burn stuff to make better stuff that doesn't break or burn.

>>a4cb02b9-f90d-4ed4-a558-00166bab59e3
I'm using Firefox to emulate clicks inside a Python script which also does filesystem operations and controls the opening and closing of ZeroNet instances.
It's a macro inside a script, the macro is executed once the rest ran successfully.
